CHAPTER 12-15
PEDESTRIANS
12-15-1
DESIGNATION OF CROSSWALKS
The City Council is hereby authorized and empowered to establish and to designate and
shall thereafter maintain, by appropriate devices, marks or lines upon the surface of the
roadway, crosswalks approximately equal in width to the adjacent sidewalks at all
intersections where in their opinion, there is particular danger to pedestrians crossing
the roadway.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 5, Article XV, 
SDCL Ch. 32-27.
§296, 3/11/74.
12-15-2
DESIGNATION OF SAFETY ZONES
The City Council is hereby empowered to establish safety zones of such kind and
character and at such places as they may deem necessary for the protection of
pedestrians.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 5, Article XV, 
SDCL Ch. 32-27.
§297, 3/11/74.
12-15-3
PEDESTRIAN'S RIGHT-OF-WAY
The operator of any vehicle shall yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian crossing the
roadway within any marked crosswalk or within any unmarked crosswalk at the end of a
block, except at intersections where traffic is being regulated by police officers or traffic
control signals.
Whenever any vehicle has stopped at a marked crosswalk or at any intersection to
permit a pedestrian to cross a roadway, it shall be unlawful for the operator of any other
vehicle approaching from the rear to overtake and pass such stopped vehicle.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 5, Article XV, 
SDCL § 32-27-1
§298, 3/11/74.
12-15-4
PEDESTRIANS RIGHTS AND DUTIES AT CONTROLLED
INTERSECTIONS
Whenever stop signals, signs or flashing red signals are in place at an intersection or a
marked crosswalk between intersections the pedestrian shall have the right-of-way over
drivers of vehicles and at such marked places drivers of vehicles shall stop before
entering the nearest crosswalk and any pedestrian within or entering the crosswalk at
either edge of the roadway shall have the right-of-way over any vehicle so stopped.

The driver of a vehicle shall stop before entering any crosswalk when any vehicle
proceeding in the same direction is stopped at such crosswalk for the purpose of
permitting a pedestrian to cross.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 5, Article XV, 
SDCL § 32-27-2.
§299, 3/11/74.
12-15-5
JAYWALKING
Every pedestrian crossing a highway within a business, school, or residence district at
any point other than a pedestrian crossing, crosswalk or intersection shall yield the
right-of-way to vehicles upon the highway.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 5, Article XV, 
SDCL § 32-27-4.
§300, 3/11/74.
12-15-6
PEDESTRIANS TO OBEY TRAFFIC SIGNALS
At intersections where traffic is directed by a policeman or stop-and-go signals, it shall
be unlawful for any pedestrian to cross the roadway other than with released traffic and
pedestrians shall obey all traffic signals and directions.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 5, Article XV, 
SDCL § 32-27-3.
§301, 3/11/74.
12-15-7
PEDESTRIANS TO USE RIGHT HALF OF CROSSWALK
Pedestrians shall move, whenever practicable, upon the right half of the crosswalks.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 5, Article XV, 
SDCL §§ 9-32-1, 9-29-3.
§302, 3/11/74.
12-15-8
SOLICITING RIDES
It shall be unlawful for any person to stand in a roadway for the purpose of soliciting a
ride from the operator of any private vehicle.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 5, Article XV, 
SDCL §§ 9-32-1, 9-29-3.
§303, 3/11/74.
